attributes.action: Continue to apply social justice through inheritance tax
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Inheritance tax exists to level out the inequalities that allowed a small group in society to pass on disproportionate advantages over successive generations creating self propagating fortunes that denied resources and opportunity to the majority regardless of their ability or need.

Wealth generated by the appreciation of assets, including property, is not "earned"  and should be taxed like any other capital gain. To pay income tax on the wages that paid a £50,000 mortgage is not to pay tax on the £200,000 the same house may now sell for.

It is not appropriate to tax the dead as they cannot enjoy any wealth that they leave. Inheritance tax should be levied against their beneficiaries according to their financial status.

There is no  social worth in allowing a millionaire to inherit a £250,000 house tax free. Similarly for 4 children to share an inheritance of a million pounds is as valid as an only child inheriting a £250,000 estate alone.

Change inheritance tax to make it fairer, not to support a new idle rich.
